definition: to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine

sentences.english: The living room was dark, except for some light flickering out of the muted television set.
sentences.chinese: 客廳很黑，只有沒聲音的電視機在忽閃忽閃地發着光。

sentences.english: The living room was dark, except for some light flickering out of the muted television set.
sentences.chinese: 客廳很黑，只有沒聲音的電視機在忽閃忽閃地發着光。

sentences.english: Dim lights flickered above the noodle stalls.
sentences.chinese: 昏暗的光在麪條攤上忽閃着。

sentences.english: Ito/Iko flashed a broad smile and fluffed at his hair, which was, she decided, slightly tinted with blue, and glistening in the candlelight.
sentences.chinese: 她覺得他的頭髮染了點藍色，所以在燭光下忽閃着。

sentences.english: July a pair of almonds eye son suddenly Shan suddenly Shan, 1 face expectancy the ground looking by one oneself space space.
sentences.chinese: 七月一雙杏眼兒忽閃忽閃，一臉期待地看着自家格格。
